text.__SUMMARY__: The small-toothed fruit bat (Neopteryx frosti) is a species of megabat in the family Pteropodidae. It is monotypic within the genus Neopteryx.
text.Distribution: This fruit bat is endemic to central Indonesia. It is known only from two localities on Sulawesi island. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical dry forests.
text.Conservation: It is an IUCN Red List Endangered species,  due to continued habitat decline and intense hunting.

Bats of Indonesia
Endemic fauna of Indonesia
